Summary: great little hotel.  rooms were updated, clean.  new floors - no carpet... i love hard floors rather than carpet.  new tVs with cable. Refrig that kept my stuff cold.  little microwave.  bathroom was newly updated. quiet... i heard no noise through the walls. i heard no voices outside my window.  comfy bed.  it was a great bargain.  I travel a lot, stay in a lot of hotels.  I ended up at this hotel by chance.  I was bothered by no one and had no problems. This is a budget hotel, the kind where you park outside your door. it was a very good bargain for the price.

I was not planning to stay at the Beach but after I was stung by 2 stingrays I was not able to drive safely.  I found this place at a fair price and breakfast was included.  Very close to everything and nice comfortable beds.

Summary Heading: Clean and quiet, well located at a crossroads, at a nice low price
Summary: I was in Huntington Beach on business, not pleasure, so I wasn't looking for a luxurious hotel or to be on the sand, just a nice, cost-effective place to stay for two nights.  I found this motel to fill the bill just fine--the price was quite quite low, it was located at a kind of crossroads, on Beach Boulevard that makes a bee-line from the 405 freeway to the Pacific Coast Highway and the ocean, and on the same block as the diagonal Main Street, so it felt like all of Huntington Beach was easily accessible.  Despite being on a "main drag", I felt that the room was very quiet.  Every reference calls this motel "Starlight Inn", except the sign in front that says "Rodeway Inn".  I can only guess that maybe Rodeway bought the motel, but the transition to the new name is proceeding

We booked this motel thru Booking.com under the name Starlight Inn Huntington Beach and spent ages trying to find it as they have changed the name outside to Rodeway Inn and we thought we were at the wrong place. It wasnt till we got a call on our cell phone to find out why we hadnt booked in that we realised we were at the right motel. The owners were rude and unhelpful when I asked why we werent notified of the name change.The room was adequate and the beds were average. The whole place is quite run down and we had to carry our bags up stairs to the third floor.It was averagely clean. Wouldn't stay there again!

We travelled on a budget holiday here as part of a group. Honestly, this was easily the worst place we stayed by far.  We were arriving late, so made sure to ring in advance, owner seemed very thankful for the call, and said it was no problem to check in late. When we arrived, there was no sign of the owner. We rang the bell numerous times, and called the phone, to no avail. After about 10-15 minutes standing in the dark, we contemplated just sleeping in our cars.  The owner then turned up, with no apology for the delay, and barely spoke to us during out check in. However, it was late, so we didn't really mind.  Then the nightmare started! As we brought in our bags, a drunk man attempted to come in to our room. I know this is not the owners fault, but a bit unsettling to say the

This is by far the worst experience I have ever had at any establishment in my life, we were there for 5 minutes and the owner was giving me lots of attitude when he took far too long to show up, this place is filthy and not worth anyone's money.

I stayed here one night,It was awful. I know it was cheap but I did except to be able to sleep, the bed was the most uncomfortable bed that I have "tried" to sleep upon, the owners were unfriendly, more interested in making their chapatis! Too near massage parlours and seedy things, this put. Me out of my comfort zone. Never again.

Summary Heading: I stayed there 3 months and loved it!
Summary: What do you expect in a hotel when it's around $55.00 a night 2 miles from the Beach? Yes, it could have been cleaner, but it was better than I thought it would be. It had a large 42 flat screen TV, with a queen side bed, AC, Heat, refrigerator, microwave oven and again only 2 miles from Hunting Beach Pier. Chris the manager was very nice and professional and did everything for me to make my stay very enjoyable. I would stay there again and again, when every other hotel in the area was twice to 3 times as much... you got to be kidding me.

The pictures of this place are deceiving. First they wouldn't give me a confirmation number for the reservation. The room was disgusting the towels were dirty the beds suck. The lamp shade was missing, holes in the bathroom door, the door knob to the bathroom was broken, the toilet paper was literally tissue paper, it smelled like curry, the wifi didn't work, the toilet seat was broken, the shower was disgusting!!!!! Crayon marks on the doors, the staples on the carpet were out, we went  and bought our own sheets,towels and pillow cases we were so disgusted. BEWARE IT'S DISGUSTING

Summary Heading: Now I have stayed in a hovel!
Summary: Curse me for not using Trip Advisor when booking this hotel because then I would have known ~ that little restful sleep occurs when sleeping on a poorly covered king box spring ~that a motel in 2012 does NOT provide ANY form of soap ~ that a malfunctioning shower head can and will spray the bathroom, the floor, and the adjoining dressing area in 2.0 seconds ~ that three kinds of bugs (ants, gnats and daddy longlegs) live in hovels in Huntington Beach in November. Beyond that, the door did lock and the taped window kept most of the fog at bay.  Glad to leave this one behind.  People, please do not make my mistake.  Use Trip Advisor EVERY time you leave home.

Overall a good stay.. Friendly staff and clean rooms but quite far away from the beach and "mainstreet" with all the restaurants and shops.. Really liked Huntington beach itself, awesome beach and lots of great restaurants!!

We joked about how bad it was... We survived... Most Surrounding Hotels are very expensive... so we were glad to at least have something... The WiFi worked and no extra charge for it.... Old round Tube TV with broken DirecTV - he came and fixed it though. The Kicker - there was pistachio shells all over the mat and the walkway in the front of our room, we asked if they would sweep them up - they swepped up some of them - Hilarious, like - you cant sweep up all of them. We never did get rid of all the pistachio shells at our front entrance.

The outside looked nice/average. They only had 1 room left and it was a smoking room. I don't smoke but he was nice enough to let me look at the room to check it out. I did a quick look just see how bad the smell was and it wasn't that bad. He told me it was going to be 84 but gave it to me for 75. I really should of took a better look at the room first. But it was a Friday night and everything else around was sold out or close to 200. for the night. They offered free HBO but there was no channels at all. So no t.v I didn't feel comfortable sleeping there. It felt dirty. The walls looked dirty. The shower curtain was filthy and so was the window curtain. Counter tops and desk looked dirty. The towels looked stained and had hair on them. The window had duck tape around it. The
This is the worst motel I've ever stayed in my life. The walls were full of dirt n hand print, hair in the beds, ants in the bathroom and it smelled like curry. Don't stay here unless u have too!

Summary Heading: Where the bugs are hiding in the bed...
Summary: Ok, we were tired of searching for a place to stay in that night and as nearly all the other hotels had no vacancy we were happy to have a place to stay for the night. We didn't expect the best and the first impression was slightly ok (no Cockroaches). But the bathroom was really dirty and smelled like an ash tray. The first night was ok because 75 dollars are cheap for 5 people and we decided to stay another night and then the real nightmare began. We had nearly 30 bed bugs killed until we moved out. My body looked like streusel cake the next few days.  If you search for a cheap place to stay, you can do that, but it can ruin the rest of your trip.

Came here as a last resort and regretted not spending the extra money for a better place. Everything is really dirty, the comforter smelled like urine, and there were ants in the bed. Not to mention the questionble stains on the chairs and drapes. Avoid this place at all costs!

Very powerfull to disgusting aroma of curry and un clean.  Room was dirty, no fridge, asked for one and it was shoved into the room, dirty. Ants everywhere.  Everything broken or breaking. Managemnt happy to be advised that we would leave bad feed back on trip advisor.  The Inn was given a good review in the Huntington Beach Information magazine. Sleep in the car you will be more comfortable!

Summary Heading: Stay here ONLY if you HAVE to...
Summary: Yes... definitely stay here if you:   bring your own (clean) towels  bring your own (clean) sheets  bring a can of ant spray  wear shoes the whole time, so your feet don't touch the icky carpet   Oddly enough... their wifi is really good!

The room was great for the over -night traveler or the person that was staying there for a extended time. I found the staff (very limited, three people) extremely nice. I would not take my family their but as a business traveler for several monthes a great place to stay and no problems with the management. They were very helpful and caring. They gave me a fridge and a microwave which as you know as a long term traveler is a luxury .

An awful experience at this hotel.  There were ants on the walls and in the beds.  The management told us it was normal for the time of year (July) and handed us a can of Roach spray.  Rooms were small and floors were filthy.  Our bill was incorrect and management was very unhelpful and unprofessional.
